content: A famous French landmark, this iron lattice tower located on the Champ de Mars in Paris is named after its engineer.

Ah, you're referring to the Eiffel Tower, right? It's an iconic symbol of France and Paris, attracting millions of visitors each year. Gustave Eiffel, after whom it's named, was a brilliant French civil engineer known for his revolutionary designs in metal structures. The Eiffel Tower was built for the 1889 World's Fair, celebrating the 100th year anniversary of the French Revolution. It's impressive how it has become such a cultural icon and a testament to human ingenuity.
